title: Individuals
subtitle: Sentence Frames
desc: Students are given a partial sentence that can be used in many situations and that teaches something about grammar or academic language construction.
subject: all

title: Individuals
subtitle: Graphic Organizer
desc: Students are given a visual organizer that illustrates the type of thinking required for a task (e.g. Venn Diagram for comparison or story map for sequencing)
subject: all

title: Whole Class
subtitle: Must Haves & Amazing Criteria
desc: Students use a list of required and optional beyond criteria to annotate their own work for specific qualities.
subject: all

title: Individuals
subtitle: Annotate Image
desc: Students circle evidence related to a specific concept or topic in an image or data table.
subject: all

title: Individuals
subtitle: Fact Card
desc: Students are given facts to increase their knowledge on the topic.
subject: all

title: Teacher-structured student choice
subtitle: Tic Tac Toe Choice Board
desc: Students choose 3 out of 9 tasks and the teacher requires the center box.
subject: all

title: Total teacher assignment
subtitle: Skill Practice Activities
desc: Teachers assign each student specific practice tasks to be completed alone or in assigned small groups.
subject: all

title: Total student choice
subtitle: Reading, Research, or Problem Sets
desc: Students choose according to their interests.
subject: all

title: Discusion routine
subtitle: Domino Discover
desc: Students, individually, or a reporter from each group, share a response without interruption. Reporters contribute a new idea or repeat a previous response. Everyone's response is heard before discussion.
subject: all

title: Discussion routine
subtitle: Dialogue Lines
desc: Students form two lines to allow for rotating partnerships. All students in one line speak first then the opposite line responds. There may be free discussion before one line moves one step to form new partnerships and the process repeats allowing for 2-3 different conversations in pairs.
subject: all

title: Discusion routine
subtitle: Rumors
desc: Students circulate around the room carrying their response written on a paper. They listen to a partner's idea, share their own idea, and swap papers. Then they find a new partner to: listen, share, & swap - looking for patterns in responses.
subject: all

title: Discusion routine
subtitle: Think - Talk - Open Exchange
desc: Students take turns sharing for an equal amount of time in groups of three. The teacher ensures silent thinking time before and after each speaker. After sharing, the group works to form a response.
subject: all

title: Individual thinking routine
subtitle: Check and Circle
desc: Students independently read or scan a text. They put a check next to at least three familiar words and circle one word that seems new.
subject: all

title: Individuals
subtitle: Take Five Deep Breaths
desc: Students breathe in through their noses for a count of five, hold the air for three, and then breathe out through their mouths for 7 counts. Each time, ask students to fill more of their body with breath.
subject: all

title: Individuals
subtitle: Concept Map
desc: Students organize their thinking by drawing a visual representation of their ideas.
subject: all

title: Whole Class
subtitle: Routine Directions Posted
desc: Students refer to displayed directions to remember steps and/or qualities of responses.
subject: all

title: Individuals
subtitle: Dictionary
desc: Students are given a resource for finding word meanings, pronounciation, and usage.
subject: all

title: Individuals
subtitle: T-Chart Organizer
desc: Students organize their thinking by drawing a visual representation of their ideas.
subject: all

title: Total teacher assignment
subtitle: Assignment
desc: Teachers assign required task - same task for all students.
subject: all

title: Teacher-structured student choice
subtitle: Practice Problems
desc: Teacher requires 3 and students choose 2 additional questions.
subject: all

title: Total student choice
subtitle: List, Draw, Story
desc: Students respond by drawing, writing, or making a list.
subject: all

title: Discussion routine
subtitle: Elbow Exchange and Sort
desc: Students are assigned the role of listener or speaker, taking turns to exchange their thinking (answer, question, opinion, observation). Then the pair sorts their ideas by a type of thinking (e.g. prioritize, compare, sequence, or summarize).
subject: all

title: Discussion routine
subtitle: Idea Carousel
desc: Teachers post chart papers with different topics around the room. Then ask students to stand by the most interesting topic and direct students to write on chart paper knowledge, questions, or concerns about the topic. Teachers stop the work and ask students to rotate to the next chart and repeat this process.
subject: all

title: Explicit instruction
subtitle: Mini-lesson
desc: Teachers demonstrate a concept, defines vocabulary, or provides an example.
subject: all

title: Individual thinking routine
subtitle: I used to think... Now I think... So next I will..
desc: Students independently monitor how and why their thinking has changed and plan next steps by completing the sentence prompt, "I used to think...now I think…so next I will…"
subject: all

title: Individual thinking routine
subtitle: Star Most Interesting & Box Most Challenging
desc: Students place a star next to the most interesting word/problem/question and draw a box around the most challenging aspect.
subject: all

title: Discusion routine
subtitle: Questions Only
desc: Students work in pairs to generate questions around a prompt, image, or data set.
subject: all

title: Individuals
subtitle: Learning App
desc: Students use software to practice a skill.
subject: all

title: Individuals
subtitle: Vocabulary list
desc: Students use a list of academic words including multisyllabic, abstract meanings, and prefix/suffixes.
subject: all

title: Individuals
subtitle: Materials and Tools
desc: Students use materials and tools to support learning (i.e. calculator, ruler, map, compass, etc.).
subject: all

title: Whole Class
subtitle: Word Wall
desc: Students refer to a visual display of key terms, their meaning, and word relationships.
subject: all

title: Total teacher assignment
subtitle: Small Group Instruction
desc: Teacher assigns different required tasks for small group work.
subject: all

title: Total student choice
subtitle: Interest Projects
desc: Students generate their own project to demonstrate learning.
subject: all

title: Discussion routine
subtitle: Questions, Answers, Practice, Switch (Peer Tutoring)
desc: Students who are ready to teach a skill pair up with a student hoping to learn the skills. The Learner asks questions for 30 seconds. The student who is teaching answers the most important question and then practices the skill with the learner. Then roles are switched and the routine repeats where learner must now answer questions to demonstrate learning.
subject: all

title: Explicit instruction
subtitle: Short Movie Clip
desc: Students watch a short movie clip to find information to answer a question.
subject: all

title: Individual thinking routine
subtitle: Silent Think Time
desc: Students silently think or imagine in their head with no writing or speaking.
subject: all

title: Discusion routine
subtitle: Sort-it-Out
desc: Students sort words, images, facts or objects into groups and create titles for each group. Students create at least three different sorts. Students share their most effective sort with peers who must guess the titles of the groups.
subject: all

title: Opportunity
subtitle: Design Your Own Routine
desc: Choose a routine from any card or design your own!

title: Opportunity
subtitle: Design Your Own Routine
desc: Choose a routine from any card or design your own!

title: Opportunity
subtitle: Design Your Own Routine
desc: Choose a routine from any card or design your own!

title: Opportunity
subtitle: Design Your Own Routine
desc: Choose a routine from any card or design your own!

title: Opportunity
subtitle: Design Your Own Routine
desc: Choose a routine from any card or design your own!

title: Welcome to the Agility game lobby!

When other players log in, they will join the video chat.
When someone presses the PLAY button, the game will start.

Discuss the IF" teaching challenge with your team. Use the survey questions to set goals for your teaching response.
Someone should press the DEAL CARDS button when the team is ready."

You can choose up to three cards to play.
When the timer is up, each player will explain their choices.

It's your turn to share why you chose your cards.
If you finish before time is up, click button below.

is explaining to the team
why they chose those cards.

Discuss which cards best to address the IF issue,as well as progress the students.
When you have decided, someone should check the box to the right of that set.

Reflect on takeaways for your own teaching.
When you are ready play again, someone should press the PLAY button.
